content: crochet pattern by big woolly jumper daisy chain choker pattern notes this is a very simple crochet pattern consisting only of chains and slip stitches but it can be tricky knowing where to place your hook i used a stitch marker to mark the centre of each flower as i worked the petals around you also need to be careful not to twist the string as you go ensuring each flower gently overlaps the one before it and the right side faces up at all times don t agonise too much about counting the petals as long as they look about right a little bit of variation creates interest materials superfine yarn in colour of your choice suggested crochet hook size 3mm lobster clasp and jump ring for fastening or you can just leave some extra yarn at both ends for a tie stitch marker optional abbreviations chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch instructions round 1 chain 4 slip_stitch in first chain of this round to make a circle round 2 chain 3 slip_stitch into centre of circle x 5 times 1 x flower complete repeat rounds 1 and 2 until your string of flowers reaches the desired length mine is 38cm crochet pattern by big woolly jumper finishing finish with a slip_stitch into the base of the first petal in the final flower to close the petal gap cut yarn and pull through weave in ends and attach a clasp and jump ring to the ends alternatively leave a yarn tail at the ends to tie copyright information daisy chain choker by big woolly jumper © 2025 kathleen crotty do not copy alter share or sell pattern pictures or images copies or alterations may be made for owner s personal use only you are welcome to sell your finished items if you do so online kindly credit the pattern to big woolly jumper pg 2 © 2025 kathleen crotty
